sean.title: Sign up: ElevenLabs ($11/mo)
steps: 4. Browse voice library - listen to 5-6 different voices

sean.title: Sign up: InVideo AI ($20/mo)
steps: - Try: 'Create a 60-second video about saving $1000 in 30 days'
- Watch the output - check quality, pacing, visuals
- Upgrade to Plus plan ($20/mo) to remove watermark
7. Once confirmed, send me login so I can automate bulk uploads

meta.testFirst: Yes - don't commit until you've seen output quality

sean.title: Apply to 5 affiliate programs
steps: - Website field: Add your YouTube channel URLs
- Approval: Usually instant if account good standing
- If rejected: Reapply after hitting 1K subs
- Great for 'how to start a blog' content
- Apply individually: Target, Home Depot, etc.
- Share with Jon so I can auto-insert in video descriptions

meta.timing: Do AFTER channels created + 5 videos posted
meta.tip: Track every click/conversion in the sheet

jon.title: Cost optimization sprint
steps: Test cheaper models in isolated sub-agents:
Benchmark: quality, speed, tool-use, cost per 1M tokens
Enable prompt caching (save 90% on repeated context)

jon.title: Build YouTube automation scripts
steps: - Input: video file, title, description, tags
- Fetch daily: views, CTR, watch time, revenue
Test end-to-end: Generate ‚Üí Upload ‚Üí Schedule ‚Üí Track

meta.goal: 21 videos/week uploaded with zero manual work

jon.title: Test & document cheaper models
steps: - List candidates: Haiku ($0.25/$1.25), Gemini Flash (free), DeepSeek ($0.14/$0.28)
- Compare: cost, speed, tool-use, context window
- Task: 'Check email and flag urgent ones'
- Note: Previous failure might be prompt issue
- Task: Pure text work (no complex tool use)
- Measure: tokens used, time taken, success rate
- Document: What works well, what fails, when to use each
- Set up routing logic in gateway config
- Monitor: track cost savings over 1 week

meta.risk: Quality might suffer - need careful testing
meta.fallback: Can always revert to 100% Claude if needed

futureProjects.name: üåè Hire Philippines VA ($4-6/hr)
futureProjects.reasoning: Scale video production beyond automation limits. VA can handle: custom thumbnails, manual editing for high-value content, community management (reply to comments), research trending topics.
nextSteps: Post on onlinejobs.ph: 'YouTube Shorts VA - video editing + research'
Test task: 'Create 5 thumbnail variations for this video'
Start 5-10 hrs/week, scale to 20 hrs/week if profitable

futureProjects.name: üìß Email List Building
futureProjects.reasoning: Own your audience - YouTube can ban/demonetize anytime. Email list = insurance + direct sales channel. Can sell digital products, courses, coaching.
nextSteps: Wait until: 10K total subscribers across channels
Set up: ConvertKit ($25/mo) or Beehiiv (free tier)
Lead magnet: '30-Day Money Challenge PDF' (finance channel)
Link in video descriptions + pinned comments
Send 1 email/week: mix of tips + product recommendations

futureProjects.name: üéôÔ∏è Podcast Repurposing
futureProjects.reasoning: YouTube Shorts ‚Üí Gateway drug. Podcast = deeper engagement + sponsor opportunities ($500-5K per episode after growth).
nextSteps: Wait until: 50K subs on one channel
Format: 20-30 min deep dives on Shorts topics

futureProjects.name: üõí Dropshipping or FBA (Revisit)
futureProjects.reasoning: Sean has experience but projects didn't finish. Higher upfront cost + inventory risk. YouTube Shorts is better for current situation: lower risk, faster feedback, builds personal brand.
futureProjects.revisitWhen: After YouTube hits $2K/mo sustainable OR if strong product idea emerges
futureProjects.cons: Inventory risk, logistics headaches, competition is brutal

futureProjects.name: üéì Skill Development Focus Areas
futureProjects.reasoning: Sean identified 'lack of certain skills' as blocker. YouTube Shorts project intentionally uses AI/automation to compensate. But long-term: developing these skills = unlock bigger opportunities.

skillsToLearn.why: More control over quality + can offer services
Better titles/descriptions = higher CTR = more revenue
skillsToLearn.how: Study top channels + A/B test variations

skillsToLearn.why: Automate even more - scraping, data analysis, custom tools
Understand what makes videos go viral
skillsToLearn.how: Study VidIQ tutorials + analyze successful channels

futureProjects.approach: Learn by doing - apply immediately to YouTube project. 80% execution, 20% learning.

decisions.reasoning: Lowest barrier to entry, fastest feedback loop, can automate heavily with AI, builds audience for future products. Sean's pattern: struggles finishing projects. Shorts = small wins every week = maintains momentum.
decisions.alternatives: Podcast (too much upfront work), Blog (SEO takes 6-12 months), Dropshipping (inventory risk + past failures)

decisions.reasoning: Diversification = risk reduction. If one niche flops, others might succeed. Also: tests Sean's interests - will naturally gravitate to favorite after 30 days.
decisions.tradeoff: Slower growth per channel vs hedged bets

decisions.reasoning: Speed. Can generate video in 10 min vs hours for human editor. Quality good enough for Shorts. Budget: editor = $200-500/mo vs tool = $20/mo.
decisions.fallback: If InVideo quality poor, switch to Pictory or hire VA part-time

decisions.decision: Claude Sonnet primary, test cheaper for sub-tasks
decisions.reasoning: Current burn rate unsustainable ($5-10/week). Need to cut 60% but maintain quality. Strategy: use Claude for complex decisions, cheaper models for bulk work.
decisions.risk: Cheaper models might fail at tool use - need careful testing
